doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia

Highest house purchase in AC history = $8,500,000 by John Werner Kluge 1987--Charles A Stone Home 1926--Whitney Stone Home--Margaret Patterson Home--Iron Water Pump from Overton School--Mantel Details from William Pain--Thomas Jefferson plan for Higginbotham in 1820 not realized

2 Story Brick, Paired Column Portico, Fanlight, 5 Bay, 2 Pile, Blinds, 6/6, Barred Cellar Windows, Rubbed Brick Cornice, Interesting Mantels, 6 Panel Door, 2 Leaf Door,Reciprocating Saw Marks, Flemish Bond, Queens Closers, Penciling, 3 Course American Bond, Smokehouse, Slave Quarters, Gardens; Kitchen: 1 Story Brick, 5 Course American Bond, 7 Course American Bond, 6/6, Oven, Recipro-cating Saw Marks, Pitsaw Marks, Ships Ladder, Mortise and Tenon Joinery, Pegged Joinery, Roman Numerals, Step Brick Cornice; Stone Cobblers Shop: Round Log JoistsOutdoor Sculpture by Maillol, Rodin, Marini, Abakanowicz, Graham, Manzu, Martini, Giacometti, Moore, Arneson
Martin Thacker, Builder 1821--Howard Sill, Architect 1926--Annette Hoyt Flanders, garden restoration 1930
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Virginia Road Traces--Work Projects Administration
